definitions.definition: the point when somebody/something is best, most successful, strongest, etc.

examples.text: Traffic **reaches its peak** between 8 and 9 in the morning.
the **peaks and troughs** of married life
She's at the peak of her career.
Membership of the club has fallen from a peak of 600 people in 2022.
Her performance is just past its peak.
Production is rising back towards its 2019 peak.
The crisis was now at its peak.
The graph shows two very sharp price peaks.
The influx of tourists has reached its summer peak.

definitions.definition: the pointed top of a mountain; a mountain with a pointed top

examples.text: The climbers made camp halfway up the peak.
We looked up at the rocky peaks towering above us.

definitions.definition: any narrow and pointed shape, edge, etc.

examples.text: Whisk the egg whites into stiff peaks.
He combed his hair into a peak.

definitions.definition: the stiff front part of a cap that sticks out above your eyes

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: probably a back-formation from peaked, variant of dialect picked ‘pointed’.
